definitions.definition: To compensate; to pay.
definitions.example: The workers were generously remunerated for their time.

definitions.definition: Iron(II) sulfate.
A person whose work is to fell trees.
A lumberjacket.
To belittle or express disapproval of.
definitions.example: He deprecates any praise of his own merits.

definitions.definition: To declare something obsolescent; to recommend against a function, technique, command, etc. that still works but has been replaced.
definitions.example: It is still supported but strongly deprecated.

definitions.definition: To pray against.
To regret deeply.
In manner that deprecates; insulting; belittling.
definitions.example: He raised his hand with a deprecating gesture.

definitions.definition: (collective) A bundle of sticks or brushwood intended to be used for fuel tied together for carrying. (Some sources specify that a faggot is tied with two bands or withes, whereas a bavin is tied with just one.)
Burdensome baggage.
A bundle of pieces of iron or steel cut off into suitable lengths for welding.
A burning or smouldering piece of firewood.
A meatball made with offcuts and offal, especially pork. (See Wikipedia.)
An annoying or inconsiderate person.
A shrewish woman.
A homosexual man, especially an effeminate one.
A man considered weak, effeminate, timid, pathetic, emotional, non-heteronormative in some way
A soldier numbered on the muster-roll, but not really existing.
A faggot voter.
Of, relating to, or characteristic of a professor or professors, or of a professorship or professorships.
Of or pertaining to a duke, a duchess, or the duchy or dukedom they hold.
A cast from supertype to subtype.
A melancholy look.
A ventilating shaft down which the air passes in circulating through a mine.
To cast or throw down; to turn downward.
To taunt; to reproach; to upbraid.
To cast from supertype to subtype.
(of eyes) Looking downwards.
(of a person) Feeling despondent.
Traditional African medicine.
A green chalcedony that has been sprinkled with red spots (which resemble blood, hence the name).
Hematite.
Accompanying drone in Byzantine music.
Beheading; the act of beheading or decapitating
The ousting or destruction of the ruling body of a government or other organization.
definitions.example: A decapitation strike carried out by drone killed many of the country's senior generals.

definitions.definition: The unseating of a senior politician.
definitions.example: The decapitation of the Foreign Secretary was a significant publicity coup for the opposition.

definitions.definition: Any of a class of organic compound, cyclic ethers, having a three-membered ring; they are prepared by the selective oxidation of alkenes or by ring-closure of halohydrins; used to make plastics
Any similar compound in which an ether linkage has been made across a larger ring
Boredom or tediousness; ennui.
Someone who studies or practises archaeology.
Skill in, and knowledge of, the work of navigating, maintaining, and operating a vessel.
Fantastic.
A fruit-bearing shrub or small tree, Punica granatum.
The fruit of Punica granatum, about the size of an orange and having a red pulp containing many seeds and enclosed in a thick, hard, reddish skin.
A dark red colour, like that of a pomegranate.
